channel.name: Has anyone deployed a zkapp using actions and called the reducer multiple times successfully?

messages.content:
I have a zkapp using the action/reducer model and I can reduce one action successfully, but if I try to reduce 2+ actions on the first reduce, or if I try to call reduce again after the first time, I get an error that my zkapp sequence state precondition is not satisfied.

I have unit tests that work in this case, and I only have problems on a remote network.  If anyone else has ever successfully deployed a reducer and used it over and over, I'd love to see the transactions and the code to see if it helps me debug.
No, I was not able to get through many transaction errors that started arising on the second reduce()
Ok thanks for adding your anecdote.  It's the same thing, where it works once but not twice?
Can you share the code you were using, ideally on the specific commit hash?  Did you already open an issue?  If not I can open one with both of our examples.

The code is at
https://github.com/dfstio/minanft-lib/blob/approve/experimental/reducer.test.ts

No, I didn't open the issue as I needed short code that demonstrates it quickly; I decided not to invest my time in this and concentrated on serverless, which is more critical for my project.
Perfect thanks for sharing
It is my post regarding the attempt to run this code:  https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/915745847692636181/1173310094893662228
@o1martin we should probably focus on fixing the actions DX soon
I'll take a look at the Archive Node API and see if there's something weird with the logic that returns the latest blocks. I'll take a look over the weekend
Thanks for posting some test code @DFST , I'll use that reducer script to reproduce the issues on my end
@o1martin i opened this issue as well: https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1255

embeds.title: Unexpected behavior when reducing actions on live network Â· Issue #...
embeds.description: Summary While building a ZkApp with actions/reducer, I have been unable to get reduce() to work after the first time. This only happens on live networks, and is not reproducible in a test suite usi...

messages.content: Awesome, more examples the better, thank you!

@45930 I used your TutorialElection code and just ran through the steps of deploying the TutorialElection Smart Contract, setting the elector, submitting votes, and reducing the votes, and it worked when fixing https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/issues/1191 in o1js. This is the transaction that does the reduce here: https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/transaction/5JvHsZv6R3iCtBH7pJ6WJNZt3pUVHRV8aksXLs8aYofWQW8ojKGX

Going to post the same on the issue, if you would like to fix the root cause in o1js, it's up for grabs 😄 

Going to do more testing on my end but you should be able to remove that `.reverse()` line and that should work
That looks like a single call to reduce.  The first one always works - what happens if you vote again and reduce again?
Will go ahead and try
I am trying on my end as well
Hell yeah it worked!
Great work!
@Comdex is a legend 🎉
Hmm, I dispatched 2 actions and reducing is failing
@o1martin interesting... you may want to try with a simpler example though.  It's possible that I just f'd up the reducer logic with my complex action type.
Fair enough, I'll do more testing throughout the weekend.
@o1martin can you send the tx that fails for 2 actions?  I'm interested in the tx details and error message
sure thing, it's the last 3 attempted transaction on this account https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/wallet/B62qpUQCfc8s5Su7c7qksbkP5WZnGy4rSX8NuTVfjmMLAvGvCJNTPXf

I believe I found the issues, one was with o1js reversing the fetched actions, and one was with the archive node api not properly filtering the latest `fromActionState`, which lead to incorrect hash results. These two fixes here: https://github.com/o1-labs/Archive-Node-API/pull/92 and here: https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1258 should enable reducers to work as expected. This is the account I used to verify on Berkeley of multiple dispatches/reducing https://berkeley.minaexplorer.com/wallet/B62qiyCpTBxHN1ZVNKTHa5X6v9JieqFno5fXZHtdcynhGrLhFznucqQ (using your example contract from before)
Great work @o1martin !
https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1258

embeds.title: fix: remove reversing fetched actions by MartinMinkov Â· Pull Reques...

messages.content: @o1martin This is great stuff.. I see that the PRs are merged. Is it ready for testing immediately?
Thanks! We will need to make a release for o1js, we will get that prioritized and get it out asap.

o1js version `0.14.2` has been released, as well as the necessary fixes for the Archive Node APIs being deployed by providers, please try out actions/reducers now and enjoy! If there are any issues, please tag me and I will try my best to address asap

Hi @here! I've upgraded today to o1js 0.14.2, and my Action/Reducer test is passing now both on Berkeley and Testworld2!
Thank you very much @o1martin , I really appreciate such a fast and professional resolution of the issue!
